FAQ

Have questions? Here are some answers.

Below are some common questions I receive. If you don't find the answer you're looking for, feel free to call or email me, and I'll get back to you with the information within 24 hours.

What is a Licensed Electrical Contractor and why should I hire one?

Licensed Electrical Contractors are the only businesses, with certain exemptions, in Ontario legally authorized to do electrical work in your home or facility. All Licensed Electrical Contractors:

  • carry liability insurance;

  • have Workplace Safety and Insurance Board coverage;

  • understand that they must arrange for an electrical notification to ESA;

  • are qualified to perform electrical work to meet the Ontario Electrical Safety Code;

  • can show an ECRA/ESA licence number

For more information contact ESA at: https://esasafe.com/hiring-an-electrician-or-contractor/

Are you licensed and insured?

Yes, I am fully licensed and insured to perform electrical work. I am a certified Master Electricians, ensuring high-quality and code-compliant service.

What areas do you serve?

I proudly serve clients in Ottawa and surrounding areas and I'm also pleased to offer services across most of Ontario. Please contact me to confirm that I can assist you in your location.

How do I schedule an appointment?

You can schedule an appointment by calling me directly at  (343) 596-6337  or by email at  rmaxwell@sparkeunlimited.ca. I'll get back to you promptly to confirm your appointment.

Do you provide free estimates?

Yes, I offer free estimates for most services. I'll assess your needs and provide a detailed quote based on the scope of work required.

Can you install standby generators or EV chargers?

Yes, I specialize in the installation of standby generators (including Generac) and EV chargers. I'll guide you through the process and ensure the installation meets all safety and performance standards.

How do I know if I need an electrical panel upgrade?

You may need an electrical panel upgrade if you notice frequent circuit breaker trips, flickering lights, or if your current panel is outdated and not equipped to handle modern electrical loads. I can evaluate your system and recommend the best solution.

Do I need an electrical permit for my project?

Most electrical projects, especially those involving new installations or major upgrades, require a permit. I'll handle the permitting process and ensure all work complies with local regulations. Note that permit fees are additional.

What should I do if I have flickering lights or frequent power outages?

Flickering lights or frequent power outages may be a sign of a bigger electrical issue, such as faulty wiring or an overloaded circuit. Contact me immediately for an inspection, and I'll diagnose and resolve the problem.

How often should I schedule electrical maintenance for my home or business?

Regular electrical maintenance is crucial for safety and efficiency. I recommend scheduling an inspection at least once a year or whenever you notice any electrical issues. My maintenance packages also help ensure your systems remain in top condition.

What is your warranty on services or installations?

I stand behind my work with a satisfaction guarantee. My installations come with a 1 Year warranty, covering labor and materials. Please ask for more details on specific warranties for products and services.

Do you handle commercial electrical projects?

Yes, I provide comprehensive electrical services for commercial properties, including lighting installation, electrical upgrades, and new construction wiring. I'm equipped to handle jobs of all sizes for businesses.

Do you offer any discounts or promotions?

I frequently offer seasonal promotions, including discounts on services such as standby generator maintenance and installation. Be sure to ask about my current offers, and check my website for updates.

What types of payment do you accept?

I accept cash and e-transfers at the moment. I will look at expanding these options in the future.
